meanings.definition: To deprive of dignity or honor.
meanings.sent1: Bullying someone can undignify them and make them feel small.
meanings.sent2: The disrespectful behavior undignified the teacher in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to undignify the elegant cat by pulling on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The harsh criticism seemed to undignify her spirit, leaving her feeling defeated.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the historic monument undignified its significance and beauty.

meanings.definition: To lower in rank or status.
meanings.sent1: Being late to work constantly can undignify your position in the company.
meanings.sent2: The scandal undignified the politician and caused a loss of trust from the public.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled food in the fridge seemed to undignify the once prestigious restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The economic downturn undignified the wealthy neighborhood, leading to abandoned houses.
meanings.sent5: The defeat in the championship game undignified the team's previously undefeated record.
